snippet.title: A: Compiling external C++ library (Octave) for iPhone (Fortran compiler missing?)
snippet.description: . You could configure and build gfortran, but it's going to be a PITA. You'll likely need to merge in changes from Apple's customized GCC 4.2 fork found under iPhone here with a recipe for building it for Darwin, such as this. You might try f2c as the Octave project suggests. …

snippet.description: this loop in my book in the Multi-threading chapter in the section on exporting recipes. Update NSDate That sounds like a bug in the JSON parser that you are using as it should be able to handle … dates. However your workaround is viable except you need to convert it on both sides which is a PITA. I would look into your parser and see why it is not translating dates correctly as that is a pretty big omission. …

snippet.title: Q: Swapping a child template within a modal
snippet.description: I am building an ember app that features an analysis pane displayed as a modal. We have used the modal recipe from the cookbook. The analysis pane has a table of contents on the left, and a space … . This is inefficient and makes saving state a hugh PITA Using a template/View/Controller for the detail pane that encapsulates all of the available table of contents options.
